segments.text: I see the woman, her hands diligently working on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her entire focus is on that single, mundane task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so completely absorbed that she doesn't perceive the water flowing around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is now quite significant, covering a good portion of the floor near the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's distressing to see her standing in that cold, dirty water without any reaction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The running faucet and overflowing sink are a clear sign of trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why hasn't she heard the sound, or felt the water on her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's incredibly frustrating to witness such a lack of awareness when danger is so close.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The potential for slipping and getting seriously injured is very real here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her quiet concentration is admirable in other circumstances, but here, it's problematic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want her to lift her head and acknowledge the situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This routine act of dishwashing has turned into something quite precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The steady stream of water is causing damage that she will have to deal with later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a poignant depiction of being present yet entirely absent from one's surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a deep sense of concern for her and the children in this setting.
segments.speaker: PAR
